required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Bipolar Disorder in Late Life (Evaluation of MRI Hyperintensities and DTI in Bipolar Disorder)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to look at certain structural changes in the brain in people with bipolar disorder or those with a history of Bipolar disorder.

detailed_description.textblock: Individuals with bipolar disorder or those with a history of bipolar disorder may have certain structural changes in their brain. The purpose of this study is to look at those changes, as well as the assessment of risk factors for bipolar disorders, involving both social and psychological aspects of behavior, age, education, marital relations, nutrition, physical activity, etc., compared with persons not having bipolar disorder. These changes in the brain will be measured by Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI).

primary_outcome.measure: Boyko DWM Hyperintensity Value >2 in Subjects Who Received Acute Treatment for Mania
primary_outcome.description: Subject with acute mania were treated for 3 weeks with STEP-BD protocol using valproic acid as the primary intervention. Subject MRI's were evaluated for the presence of deep white matter hyperintensities (DWM) (>2 on the the Boyko Classification). Boyko lesion classification system assesses DWM hyperintensities as follows: 0 = absent, 1 = punctate, 2 = rounded <5 mm, 3 = irregular >5 mm, 4 = confluent lesions.

primary_outcome.measure: Boyko DWM Hyperintensity Value >2 in Subjects Who Received Continuation Treatment
primary_outcome.description: Subject were evaluated for relapse of their mood disorder and for the presence of DWM Hyperintensities (>2 on the the Boyko Classification. Boyko lesion classification system assesses DWM hyperintensities as follows: 0 = absent, 1 = punctate, 2 = rounded <5 mm, 3 = irregular >5 mm, 4 = confluent lesions. Subjects were also assessed for relapse, as defined by the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS)and the Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS). Relapse was defined by protocol as either a MADRS scale >15 or a YMRS scale >15.

secondary_outcome.measure: Boyko Subcortical (SC) Hyperintensity Value >2 in Subjects Who Received Continuation Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Subject were evaluated for relapse of their mood disorder and for the presence of subcortical (SC) Hyperintensities (>2 on the the Boyko Classification). Boyko lesion classification system assesses SC hyperintensities as follows: 0 = absent, 1 = punctate, 2 = rounded <5 mm, 3 = irregular >5 mm, 4 = confluent lesions. Subjects were also assessed for relapse, as defined by the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS)and the Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS).

secondary_outcome.measure: fa LOFC in Subjects Who Received Continuation Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: As an exploratory analysis, subject MRI's were also evaluated using diffusion tensor imaging (DTI) for differences in fractional anisoptery (fa) in the Left Orbitofrontal area (LOFC). FA is a scalar value between zero and one hundred that describes the degree of anisotropy of a diffusion process. A value of zero means that the diffusion is isotropic (unrestricted in all directions). A value of one hundred means that diffusion occurs only along one axis and is fully restricted along all other directions.

secondary_outcome.measure: fa ROFC in Subjects Who Received Continuation Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: As an exploratory analysis, subject MRI's were also evaluated using diffusion tensor imaging (DTI) for differences in fractional anisoptery (fa) in the Right Orbitofrontal area (ROFC). FA is a scalar value between zero and one hundred that describes the degree of anisotropy of a diffusion process. A value of zero means that the diffusion is isotropic (unrestricted in all directions). A value of one hundred means that diffusion occurs only along one axis and is fully restricted along all other directions.

arm_group.description: Subjects with acute mania who were treated with naturalistic protocol (starting with valproic acid) who had a BOYKO DWM Hyperintensity rating >2 and a YMRS <15 at week 3.
Subjects with acute mania who were treated with naturalistic protocol (starting with valproic acid)who had a BOYKO DWM Hyperintensity rating <3 and a YMRS <15 at week 3.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects recruited from the adult inpatient and outpatient psychiatric clinics at Duke University Medical Center and John Umstead Hospital (Butner, NC).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. DSM-IV diagnosis of bipolar Disorder, Manic and mixed episodes.
2. 18 years of age and older, male or female, any race.
3. Capacity to give informed consent and follow study procedures.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History of alcohol/drug dependence
2. Any metal or pacemaker in the body which precludes MRI
3. Pregnancy
4. Dementia or other primary psychiatric disorders including substance abuse/dependence, anxiety disorders, schizophrenia
5. For controls, numbers one through four above as well as any history of depression or the use of antidepressants

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were recruited from 2005-2009 from the inpatient units and Duke University Medical Center and John Umstead Hospital and the outpatient clinics at DUMC.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Only subjects currently in a manic episode were recruited for the acute treatment protocol substudy.

group.title: Naturalistic Treatment
group.description: Acutely manic subjects were treated using the Systematic Treatment Enhancement Program for Bipolar Disorder (STEP-BD) expert consensus guidelines beginning with valproic acid (titrated to therapeutic levels) over a three week period. If there was a non-response to this intervention, then a subject would continue acute treatment using other interventions indicated by STEP-BD protocols. After stabilization, subjects were followed monthly up to a year's duration and treated using the STEP-BD expert consensus guidelines.

outcome.title: Boyko DWM Hyperintensity Value >2 in Subjects Who Received Acute Treatment for Mania
outcome.description: Subject with acute mania were treated for 3 weeks with STEP-BD protocol using valproic acid as the primary intervention. Subject MRI's were evaluated for the presence of deep white matter hyperintensities (DWM) (>2 on the the Boyko Classification). Boyko lesion classification system assesses DWM hyperintensities as follows: 0 = absent, 1 = punctate, 2 = rounded <5 mm, 3 = irregular >5 mm, 4 = confluent lesions.
outcome.population: All subjects in an acute manic state who were treated with specified protocol.

group.title: Responders to Acute Treatment
group.description: Subjects in an acute manic episode who responded to treatment as measured by a Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS) <15 by week 3, which was the protocol-defined determination point for response to treatment.

group.title: Non-Responders to Acute Treatment
group.description: Subjects in an acute manic episode who did not respond to treatment as measured by a YMRS >15 by week 3.

measure.title: Boyko DWM Hyperintensity Value >2 in Subjects Who Received Acute Treatment for Mania
measure.description: Subject with acute mania were treated for 3 weeks with STEP-BD protocol using valproic acid as the primary intervention. Subject MRI's were evaluated for the presence of deep white matter hyperintensities (DWM) (>2 on the the Boyko Classification). Boyko lesion classification system assesses DWM hyperintensities as follows: 0 = absent, 1 = punctate, 2 = rounded <5 mm, 3 = irregular >5 mm, 4 = confluent lesions.
measure.population: All subjects in an acute manic state who were treated with specified protocol.

analysis.p_value_desc: a priori threshold for significance was 0.05

outcome.title: Boyko DWM Hyperintensity Value >2 in Subjects Who Received Continuation Treatment
outcome.description: Subject were evaluated for relapse of their mood disorder and for the presence of DWM Hyperintensities (>2 on the the Boyko Classification. Boyko lesion classification system assesses DWM hyperintensities as follows: 0 = absent, 1 = punctate, 2 = rounded <5 mm, 3 = irregular >5 mm, 4 = confluent lesions. Subjects were also assessed for relapse, as defined by the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS)and the Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS). Relapse was defined by protocol as either a MADRS scale >15 or a YMRS scale >15.
outcome.population: Subjects who completed at least 4-12 months of consistent follow up appointments after stabilization from an acute manic episode. Note that 3 subjects dropped out of continuation treatment.

group.title: Relapse Into Depression or Mania
group.description: Subjects who relapsed into a depressive or manic episode within the 12 months following stabilization as measured by the YMRS or MADRS scales.

group.title: Non-relapse Into Depression or Mania
group.description: Subjects who had no depressive or manic episodes within the 12 months following stabilization as measured by the YMRS or MADRS scales.

measure.title: Boyko DWM Hyperintensity Value >2 in Subjects Who Received Continuation Treatment
measure.description: Subject were evaluated for relapse of their mood disorder and for the presence of DWM Hyperintensities (>2 on the the Boyko Classification. Boyko lesion classification system assesses DWM hyperintensities as follows: 0 = absent, 1 = punctate, 2 = rounded <5 mm, 3 = irregular >5 mm, 4 = confluent lesions. Subjects were also assessed for relapse, as defined by the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS)and the Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS). Relapse was defined by protocol as either a MADRS scale >15 or a YMRS scale >15.
measure.population: Subjects who completed at least 4-12 months of consistent follow up appointments after stabilization from an acute manic episode. Note that 3 subjects dropped out of continuation treatment.

outcome.title: Boyko Subcortical (SC) Hyperintensity Value >2 in Subjects Who Received Continuation Treatment
outcome.description: Subject were evaluated for relapse of their mood disorder and for the presence of subcortical (SC) Hyperintensities (>2 on the the Boyko Classification). Boyko lesion classification system assesses SC hyperintensities as follows: 0 = absent, 1 = punctate, 2 = rounded <5 mm, 3 = irregular >5 mm, 4 = confluent lesions. Subjects were also assessed for relapse, as defined by the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS)and the Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS).
outcome.population: Number of subjects who who had >2 on the DWM hyperintensity assessment from the Boyko classification system.

group.title: Relapse Into Depression or Mania
group.description: Subjects who relapsed into a depressive or manic episode within the 12 months following stabilization as measured by the YMRS or MADRS scales.

group.title: Non-relapse Into Depression or Mania
group.description: Subjects who had no depressive or manic episodes within the 12 months following stabilization as measured by the YMRS or MADRS scales.

measure.title: Boyko Subcortical (SC) Hyperintensity Value >2 in Subjects Who Received Continuation Treatment
measure.description: Subject were evaluated for relapse of their mood disorder and for the presence of subcortical (SC) Hyperintensities (>2 on the the Boyko Classification). Boyko lesion classification system assesses SC hyperintensities as follows: 0 = absent, 1 = punctate, 2 = rounded <5 mm, 3 = irregular >5 mm, 4 = confluent lesions. Subjects were also assessed for relapse, as defined by the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS)and the Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS).
measure.population: Number of subjects who who had >2 on the DWM hyperintensity assessment from the Boyko classification system.

outcome.title: fa LOFC in Subjects Who Received Continuation Treatment
outcome.description: As an exploratory analysis, subject MRI's were also evaluated using diffusion tensor imaging (DTI) for differences in fractional anisoptery (fa) in the Left Orbitofrontal area (LOFC). FA is a scalar value between zero and one hundred that describes the degree of anisotropy of a diffusion process. A value of zero means that the diffusion is isotropic (unrestricted in all directions). A value of one hundred means that diffusion occurs only along one axis and is fully restricted along all other directions.
outcome.population: Number of subjects in continuation phase who had MRIs that were able to be processed for DTI data.

group.title: Relapse Into Depression or Mania
group.description: Subjects who relapsed into a depressive or manic episode within the 12 months following stabilization as measured by the Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS) >15 or Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) scales >15. MADRS is an ten-item diagnostic questionnaire used to measure the severity of depressive episodes in patients. Scale: 0-60 Higher MADRS scores indicate more severe depression. YMRS is an eleven-item, multiple choice diagnostic questionnaire used to measure the severity of manic episodes in patients. Scale: 0-60 Higher YMRS scores indicate more mania.

group.title: Non-relapse Into Depression or Mania
group.description: Subjects who had no depressive or manic episodes within the 12 months following stabilization as measured by the Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS) <15 or Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) scales <15. MADRS is an ten-item diagnostic questionnaire used to measure the severity of depressive episodes in patients. Scale: 0-60 Higher MADRS scores indicate more severe depression. YMRS is an eleven-item, multiple choice diagnostic questionnaire used to measure the severity of manic episodes in patients. Scale: 0-60 Higher YMRS scores indicate more mania.

measure.title: fa LOFC in Subjects Who Received Continuation Treatment
measure.description: As an exploratory analysis, subject MRI's were also evaluated using diffusion tensor imaging (DTI) for differences in fractional anisoptery (fa) in the Left Orbitofrontal area (LOFC). FA is a scalar value between zero and one hundred that describes the degree of anisotropy of a diffusion process. A value of zero means that the diffusion is isotropic (unrestricted in all directions). A value of one hundred means that diffusion occurs only along one axis and is fully restricted along all other directions.
measure.population: Number of subjects in continuation phase who had MRIs that were able to be processed for DTI data.

outcome.title: fa ROFC in Subjects Who Received Continuation Treatment
outcome.description: As an exploratory analysis, subject MRI's were also evaluated using diffusion tensor imaging (DTI) for differences in fractional anisoptery (fa) in the Right Orbitofrontal area (ROFC). FA is a scalar value between zero and one hundred that describes the degree of anisotropy of a diffusion process. A value of zero means that the diffusion is isotropic (unrestricted in all directions). A value of one hundred means that diffusion occurs only along one axis and is fully restricted along all other directions.
outcome.population: Number of subjects in continuation phase who had MRIs that were able to be processed for DTI data.

group.description: Subjects who relapsed into a depressive or manic episode within the 12 months following stabilization as measured by the Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS) >15 or Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) scales >15. measure.description: As an exploratory analysis, subject MRI's were also evaluated using diffusion tensor imaging (DTI) for differences in fractional anisoptery (fa) in the Right Orbitofrontal area (ROFC). FA is a scalar value between zero and one hundred that describes the degree of anisotropy of a diffusion process. A value of zero means that the diffusion is isotropic (unrestricted in all directions). A value of one hundred means that diffusion occurs only along one axis and is fully restricted along all other directions.

group.title: Naturalistic Treatment
group.description: Patients were treated acutely using expert consensus guidelines beginning with valproic acid. After stabilization, subjects were followed monthly up to a year's duration and treated using expert consensus guidelines. indicated.

event.description: Patient was readmitted after being found to be lithium toxic. Condition resolved without treatment. No sequela noted.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Acute MRI hypothesis unable to be tested due to high subject response. Five subject scans could not be evaluated by DTI computer program.
